result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Stichert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample. Pay a fine of $100.00 plus all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA surcharge during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.

- Complete 25 hours of community service, court approves Habitat for Humanity.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L Stichert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 DAY time served, with Huber.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Complete 25 HOURS of community service, court approves habitat for humanity.
-No contact with firearms/dangerous weapons.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
-Pay a FINE of $100.00, plus ALL court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief

Defendant Robert L Stichert in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Robert L Stichert in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.   Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-01-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Reserve Judge, Br.45.vb

Defendant Robert L Stichert in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Ann R. LÃ³pez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Resreve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 45.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/15/15 @ 1:30pm
